data.sentence: The word وَالْقَلَمِ comes from the root ق ل م and is associated with the meanings: to cut, pierce. qalam - pen, headless arrow used in casting lots.

data.meanings: To write, inscribe, draw, throw down, cut, cleanse, manage the affairs, ward, exercise authority, oversee, prostrate, set in. To embelllish stories with lies, falsehoods; stories having no foundation. To read, recite. To exercise absolute authority, to pay frequent attention to.
data.sentence: The word يَسْطُرُونَ comes from the root س ط ر and is associated with the meanings: To write, inscribe, draw, throw down, cut, cleanse, manage the affairs, ward, exercise authority, oversee, prostrate, set in. To embelllish stories with lies, falsehoods; stories having no foundation. To read, recite. To exercise absolute authority, to pay frequent attention to.
